DataElement.preferredName: Person Pincer Grip 3Jaw Device Right Hand Measurement Pressure Pound Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the Pincer grip strength generated in a prehension pattern in which the pad of the thumb on the right hand opposes the middle finger of the same hand, measured in pounds.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Pincer Grip 3Jaw Device Right Hand Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._A tool consisting of a pair of handled jaws designed for holding and pulling._The ability to hold or grasp.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3_A device designed to use opposing parts to close on and hold an object._Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north._The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being.:A tool consisting of a pair of handled jaws designed for holding and pulling.:The ability to hold or grasp.

Concepts.definition: A tool consisting of a pair of handled jaws designed for holding and pulling.
The ability to hold or grasp.

Property.preferredName: Integer::3 Jaw Device Right Hand Measurement
Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3_A device designed to use opposing parts to close on and hold an object._Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north._The distal portion of the upper extremity. Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A device designed to use opposing parts to close on and hold an object.
Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The force applied to a unit area of surface.:A traditional unit of mass. By international agreement, one avoirdupois pound is equal to exactly 0.453 592 37 kilogram, 16 ounces, or 1.215 28 troy pounds.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The force applied to a unit area of surface.
The traditional unit of mass. By international agreement, one avoirdupois pound is equal to exactly 0.453 592 37 kilogram, 16 ounces, or 1.215 28 troy pounds.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Replaces v1.0 with 1 decimal place and extended max length in v2.0

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support CCR clinical trial build in C3D. v2.0 replaces v1.0 with extended length Value Domain.
